question: What is an EPROM?

choices.choice: A memory that erases itself when the computer is switched off.
A memory that cannot be erased.
A memory that retains data when the computer is switched off but that can be re-programmed when necessary.
A memory that retains data when the computer is switched off and cannot be re-programmed.

subject: Technical

question: Which of the firewire elements must be activated to ring the fire bell in circuit below?

choices.choice: A + B or C + D.
A + C or B + D.
A + D or C + D.
Any of the above.

question: What is a ROM?

choices.choice: A memory that erases itself when the computer is switched off.
A memory that cannot be erased.
A memory that retains data when the computer is switched off but that can be re-programmed when necessary.
A memory that retains data when the computer is switched off and cannot be re-programmed.

question: An AND gate is sometimes referred to as?

choices.choice: An anything or nothing gate.
An all or nothing gate.
An everything and nothing.
A something or nothing gate.

choices.choice: Any or all gate.
All or nothing gate.
An inverted or NOT gate.
A something or nothing gate.

question: What is the function of a NOT gate?

choices.choice: To invert the input so that an opposite output is produced.
To ensure that the output is the same as the input.
To ensure that no output can be given.
To ensure an output is given only when there is no input.

C3 and C4 only.

None of the above.
